intro: Bonellia macrocarpa subsp. panamensis, commonly known as the Panama bonellia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as tropical forests. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, fleshy berries as fruits. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique morphological features and geographic distribution.
